title: Add frame-based playback control to SKLottieView
body:
Adds frame-based API for precise Lottie animation control, enabling interactive use cases like switches and scrubbers. Equivalent to Lottie web's `goToAndStop` and `goToAndPlay` methods.

## API Additions

**Properties** (read-only):
- `FrameCount`: Total frames, calculated as `Math.Round(Duration.TotalSeconds * animation.Fps)`
- `CurrentFrame`: Current frame based on progress

**Methods**:
- `SeekToFrame(int frameNumber)`: Jump to frame (0-based, clamped to [0, FrameCount-1])
- `SeekToFrameAndStop(int frameNumber)`: Jump and stop (equivalent to `goToAndStop`)
- `SeekToFrameAndPlay(int frameNumber)`: Jump and play (equivalent to `goToAndPlay`)

## Implementation

Frame-to-time conversion built on existing `Progress` property. Uses `Math.Round()` for floating-point precision. No breaking changes.

```csharp
// Switch animation example
private void OnToggle()
{
    if (isOn)
        lottieView.SeekToFrameAndStop(0);  // Off state
    else
        lottieView.SeekToFrameAndStop(lottieView.FrameCount - 1);  // On state
    
    isOn = !isOn;
}
```

## Testing

12 unit tests covering frame calculations, seeking behavior, range clamping, and edge cases.

> *This section details on the original issue you should resolve*
> 
> <issue_title>[FEATURE] Lottie play certain frames</issue_title>
> <issue_description>Be able to play to a certain frames. The lottie documentation has a [`goToAndStop`](https://airbnb.io/lottie/#/web?id=usage-1)
>  
> I'd like to create a switch using a lottie animation, but without this sort of functionality its impossible.
> https://lottiefiles.com/127464-animated-switch-ae-version
> </issue_description>
> 
> ## Comments on the Issue (you are @copilot in this section)
> 
> <comments>
> <comment_new><author>@mattleibow</author><body>
> I think all of these actions can be performed using properties:
> 
> - `IsAnimationEnabled` - `true` is start and `false` is stop
> - `Progress` - `TimeSpan` of the progress 
> - `Duration` - `TimeSpan` of the total time
> 
> If you want to get a percent progress then you can convert the `Duration` into `TotalSeconds` and then use that to get a percentage and convert back into a `TimeSpan` for the `Progress` property.</body></comment_new>
> </comments>
>
